title: Apple Java CColourUIResource Pointer Dereference Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
his vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable installations of Apple Java HotSpot. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must visit a malicious page.
The specific flaw exists in the undocumented apple.laf.CColourUIResource(long, int, int ,int, int) constructor. When passing a long integer value as the first argument, the value is interpreted as pointer to an Objective-C object. By constructing a special memory structure and passing the pointer to the first argument an attacker may execute arbitrary code.
addtionnal_details: Apple has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:http://support.apple.com/kb/HT3632
timeline:
2009-01-26 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2009-06-16 - Coordinated public release of advisory
